solution_line_template: If yesterday the number of buyers was half the number of buyers the day before, then yesterday there were {yesterday_fraction}*{day_before_yesterday_buyers} = <<{yesterday_fraction}*{day_before_yesterday_buyers}={yesterday_buyers}>>{yesterday_buyers} buyers.
Today has {buyers_difference} more buyers than yesterday, so there were {buyers_difference}+{yesterday_buyers} = <<{buyers_difference}+{yesterday_buyers}={today_buyers}>>{today_buyers} buyers today.

The total number of buyers in the store for the three days will be {today_buyers}+{yesterday_buyers}+{day_before_yesterday_buyers} = <<{today_buyers}+{yesterday_buyers}+{day_before_yesterday_buyers}={total_buyers}>>{total_buyers} buyers
